objects.name: American Robin
facts: American Robin was first scanned on June 16 2025.
Robins are small songbirds with red breasts.
They are often seen hopping on lawns hunting for worms.
Robins eat worms, insects, and berries.
They are considered a sign of spring in North America.

objects.name: Blue Jay
facts: Blue Jay was first scanned on June 17 2025.
Blue Jays are intelligent corvids with bright blue feathers.
They are known for their loud calls and bold behavior.
Blue Jays can mimic the calls of other birds.
They cache thousands of acorns each fall.

objects.name: Northern Cardinal
facts: Northern Cardinal was first scanned on June 17 2025.
Male cardinals are bright red with a black face mask.
Females are brown with reddish tinges.
They are the state bird of seven US states.
